HIV.D.Care-TreatmentCoreTODO: description goes hereQuestionnairehttp://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/Questionnaire/HIV.D.Care-TreatmentCore#0.3.0
1Whether visit was scheduled or unscheduled, clinical only or for ARV drug pick-up0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de1#Observation.value[x]
2Select if this is a scheduled visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de6#Observation.value[x]
3Temperature of the client in Celsius0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de7#Observation.value[x]
4The number of breaths per minute0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de8#Observation.value[x]
5The number of heartbeats per minute0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de9#Observation.value[x]
6The client's height in centimetres0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de10#Observation.value[x]
7The client's current weight in kilograms0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de11#Observation.value[x]
8Systolic blood pressure (SBP) in mmHg0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de12#Observation.value[x]
9Diastolic blood pressure (DBP) in mmHg0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de13#Observation.value[x]
10If the client's blood pressure cannot be taken, this should be indicated here. Otherwise, blood pressure should be measured.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de14#Observation.value[x]
11Signs that may indicate the client has a serious illness and needs triage or an emergency referral0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de15#Observation.value[x]
12Total number of times the woman has been pregnant (gravida)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de30#Observation.value[x]
13Total number of pregnancies lost/ended due to miscarriages and/or abortions before 22 weeks/5 months0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de31#Observation.value[x]
14Total number of live births after 22 weeks0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de32#Observation.value[x]
15Calculated parity is the total number of live and stillbirths0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de33#Observation.value[x]
16Client's HIV status is different from a current partner's HIV status0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de34#Observation.value[x]
17Client is currently taking ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de35#Observation.value[x]
18Client stopped taking ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de37#Observation.value[x]
19Date the medication was stopped0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de38#Observation.value[x]
20Is the client successfully established on ART?0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de39#Observation.value[x]
21Whether the client is ART naive or is restarting ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de40#Observation.value[x]
22The date on which the client was first initiated on ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de43#Observation.value[x]
23Time the client has been on ART since starting or restarting it in years and months0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de44#Observation.value[x]
24Month and year client originally started ART (documented) at a health facility in the system. The cohort is a group of patients who started ART in the same month (or quarter) and year, whose status is followed over time, using the ART register.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de45#Observation.value[x]
25Client is transferring in with records or known ART drugs and ART start date0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de46#Observation.value[x]
26Date client presented at facility (with transfer/referral slip) from another facility (and on ART) within the system0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de47#Observation.value[x]
27Name of health facility client was transferred from0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de48#Observation.value[x]
28Date client first enrols in HIV care at the facility. This applies to new clients (may also be the same date started on ART).?Begins when a person with a confirmed HIV diagnosis presents to a facility where HIV care is provided and a medical record, patient card, file or chart is opened for the first time. This could be at an HIV care/ART, MNCH or TB clinic.?WHO recommends that all patients be enrolled in HIV care at their first facility visit following an HIV-positive diagnosis (which may take place in the same facility or on the same day as the HIV diagnosis).?For patients who may have received prior ART, “newly enrolled” includes treatment-experienced patients with or without clinical records who received ART from sources outside the system (e.g. patient seen by private practitioner, patient buys drugs themselves or is sent drugs), or PrEP or short-course ARV prophylaxis for PMTCT, and have not been counted as “newly enrolled” in a system that is being monitored nationally. If a facility receives a treatment-experienced patient without records who was previously treated at a facility that reports to the national programme (and, therefore, reported as “newly enrolled” once before), an attempt should be made to retrieve the records and confirm that the patient was previously on treatment.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de49#Observation.value[x]
29Client's age when the client was enrolled in ART care0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de50#Observation.value[x]
30Facility where the client first enroled in HIV care0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de51#Observation.value[x]
31Whether or not the client received ARV drugs prior to enrolling into HIV care0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de52#Observation.value[x]
32Date ARV drugs were started prior to enrolment into HIV care/ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de58#Observation.value[x]
33Health facility (or other location) where ARV drugs were received prior to enrolment into HIV care/ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de59#Observation.value[x]
34ARV drug regimen received prior to enrolment into HIV care/ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de60#Observation.value[x]
35Does the client have any current chronic health conditions or problems?0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de61#Observation.value[x]
36The current ART regimen the client is taking0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de69#Observation.value[x]
37The date on which the client started taking the current ART regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de70#Observation.value[x]
38Treated with nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de71#Observation.value[x]
39Treated with nucleotide reverse-transcriptase inhibitors (NtRTIs)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de78#Observation.value[x]
40Treated with non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de80#Observation.value[x]
41Treated with protease inhibitors (PIs)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de85#Observation.value[x]
42Treated with integrase strand transfer inhibitors (INSTIs)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de90#Observation.value[x]
43ART regimen for treating clients living with HIV, based on national guidance0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de93#Observation.value[x]
44First-line ART regimen for adults and adolescents living with HIV0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de100#Observation.value[x]
45First-line ART regimen for children living with HIV0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de106#Observation.value[x]
46Other regimen based upon WHO recommendations0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/empty-id#Observation.value[x]
47First-line ART regimen for neonates living with HIV0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de112#Observation.value[x]
48Second-line ART regimen for adults and adolescents living with HIV0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de115#Observation.value[x]
49Second-line ART regimen for children0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de130#Observation.value[x]
50Third-line ART regimen for people living with HIV0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de144#Observation.value[x]
51Date when client started treatment for HCV0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de155#Observation.value[x]
52WHO clinical stage of client based on signs and symptoms. WHO clinical staging is a way to categorize HIV disease severity based on new or recurrent clinical events. There are 4 WHO clinical stages that range from mild symptoms (WHO clinical stage 1) to severe symptoms (WHO clinical stage 4).0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de156#Observation.value[x]
53Number of doses of antiretroviral therapy (ART) the client missed since the last visit, used for monitoring adherence0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de161#Observation.value[x]
54Client received results from viral load test0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de162#Observation.value[x]
55The date on which the client received results from viral load test0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de163#Observation.value[x]
56Reason why client was not adherent0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de164#Observation.value[x]
57Reason client intentionally stopped ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de184#Observation.value[x]
58ART treatment failure0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de191#Observation.value[x]
59General care activities to be performed during the care visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de195#Observation.value[x]
60Coinfection prevention and treatment activities performed during the care visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de213#Observation.value[x]
61Signs and symptoms of opportunistic infections or other comorbidities experienced by client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de225#Observation.value[x]
62New or recurrent clinical events used to categorize HIV disease severity based at baseline and follow up0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de252#Observation.value[x]
63WHO clinical stage of client based on signs and symptoms at start of ART0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de319#Observation.value[x]
64Date on which the client's WHO HIV clinical stage changed, including the date when the client's stage is first determined0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de324#Observation.value[x]
65CD4 cell count in cells/mm^30..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de325#Observation.value[x]
66CD4 cell percentage0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de326#Observation.value[x]
67CD4 result from first CD4 test performed (such as at treatment initiation), also may be called CD4 at ART initiation or at ART start0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de327#Observation.value[x]
68The client's first CD4 count from baseline CD4 test performed (such as at treatment initiation) was a count of <200 cells/mm30..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de328#Observation.value[x]
69The client is virally suppressed for HIV, based on the client's most recent viral load test result being less than 1000 copies/mL0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de329#Observation.value[x]
70Date the viral load test result was received from the lab or completed in the facility0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de330#Observation.value[x]
71Date on which the client tested as becoming virally suppressed, as indicated by a viral load test result under 1000 copies/mL0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de331#Observation.value[x]
72Whether the viral load is being tested for routine monitoring on a set schedule or for targeted monitoring for suspected treatment failure0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de332#Observation.value[x]
73Hepatitis B test is required0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de337#Observation.value[x]
74Hepatitis C test is recommended or should be considered0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de338#Observation.value[x]
75Syphilis test is required0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de339#Observation.value[x]
76Name of test ordered and results received for any relevant investigations carried out for client (including for TB)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de340#Observation.value[x]
77Hepatitis C test has been ordered0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de348#Observation.value[x]
78Syphilis test has been ordered0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de349#Observation.value[x]
79Client received results from viral load test0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de350#Observation.value[x]
80Hepatitis C test result0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de352#Observation.value[x]
81Hepatitis C viral load test result0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de355#Observation.value[x]
82This calculates the client's hepatitis C infection status as positive (1) or negative (0), taking into account any of the three methods for hepatitis C testing0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de356#Observation.value[x]
83Whether client has been diagnosed with syphilis0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de359#Observation.value[x]
84Reason why a substitution was made to the antiretroviral (ARV) drug regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de362#Observation.value[x]
85Provider is making a regimen switch0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de370#Observation.value[x]
86Reason why a switch to a second- or third-line regimen was made0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de371#Observation.value[x]
87A drug substitution is recommended0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de375#Observation.value[x]
88A dosage change is recommended0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de376#Observation.value[x]
89Provider is making a regimen substitution0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de377#Observation.value[x]
90Date co-trimoxazole prophylaxis prescribed to client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de378#Observation.value[x]
91Completion date of co-trimoxazole prophylaxis prescribed to client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de379#Observation.value[x]
92Dose of co-trimoxazole prophylaxis prescribed to client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de380#Observation.value[x]
93Number of days of co-trimoxazole prophylaxis prescribed to client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de381#Observation.value[x]
94Client has been on ART, but has stopped taking it or a treatment failure is suspected0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de382#Observation.value[x]
95INCLUDE VALUE SETS OF REGIMENS0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de383#Observation.value[x]
96Client is experiencing antiretroviral drug (ARV) toxicity0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de384#Observation.value[x]
97Clients status of coinfections at the time when ART was initiated0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de385#Observation.value[x]
98ART status of women to prevent mother-to-child transmission0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de388#Observation.value[x]
99Date of delivery/birth of infant if breastfeeding at ART start0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de393#Observation.value[x]
100Client living with HIV was in an ongoing sexual relationship with an HIV negative partner when ART was started0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de394#Observation.value[x]
101The date on which the client started taking the current ART regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de395#Observation.value[x]
102Name or regimen code of all other medications prescribed during the visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de396#Observation.value[x]
103Date the medications were prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de397#Observation.value[x]
104Number of doses (quantity taken at a single point in time) of drugs prescribed/dispensed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de398#Observation.value[x]
105Number of days supply of each medication or regimen prescribed during the visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de399#Observation.value[x]
106Select if any other medications were dispensed to client, including preventive treatment0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de400#Observation.value[x]
107Prescribed dosage of the medication0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de401#Observation.value[x]
108Prescribed frequency for taking the medication0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de402#Observation.value[x]
109Treatment-limiting toxicity defined as life-threatening illness, death, hospitalization, disability or resulting in treatment discontinuation or substitution0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de404#Observation.value[x]
110Date on which ARV drug regimen (one or more drugs) for client was changed within the first-line regimen (substitution)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de416#Observation.value[x]
111Reason(s) why one ore more drugs in client's first-line ARV drug regimen was changed (substituted)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de417#Observation.value[x]
112New antiretroviral (ARV) drugs after client changed regimen within the first-line regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de418#Observation.value[x]
113Date client was changed from a first-line to second-line ARV drug regimen (switch)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de419#Observation.value[x]
114Reason why client was switched from first- to second-line ARV drug regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de420#Observation.value[x]
115Date on which ARV drug regimen for client was changed within the second-line regimen (substitution)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de421#Observation.value[x]
116Reason(s) why client changed drug regimen (within the second-line)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de422#Observation.value[x]
117New ARV drugs after client changed regimen within the second- line regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de423#Observation.value[x]
118Date client was changed from a second- to third-line ARV drug regimen (switch)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de424#Observation.value[x]
119Reason why client was switched from second- to third-line ARV drug regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de425#Observation.value[x]
120Date on which ARV drug regimen for client was changed within the third-line (substitution)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de426#Observation.value[x]
121Reason(s) why client changed drug regimen (within the third-line)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de427#Observation.value[x]
122Enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client during the visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de428#Observation.value[x]
123A first enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client during the visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de429#Observation.value[x]
124The date on which the first enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de430#Observation.value[x]
125A second enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client during the visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de431#Observation.value[x]
126The date on which the second enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de432#Observation.value[x]
127A third enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client during the visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de433#Observation.value[x]
128The date on which the third enhanced adherence counselling was provided to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de434#Observation.value[x]
129Full name of person providing support to client for adherence, care, treatment and other needs (e.g. ARV pick-up if ill)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de435#Client.contact.name
130Full address or description of home of treatment supporter0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de436#Client.contact.address
131Telephone number if available, or else telephone number of neighbour/friend0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de437#Client.contact.telecom
132Name of individual or organization that provides home-based care to client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de438#Observation.value[x]
133Whether counselling and treatment was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with syphilis0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de442#Observation.value[x]
134Client accepted offer for partner services0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de444#Observation.value[x]
135HIV status of each family member at time of patient’s enrolment, including partner (for mothers)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de446#Observation.value[x]
136Unique ID number of each family member if enrolled in HIV care according to national guidelines (see unique ID number)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de447#Observation.value[x]
137Date of death for each family member as appropriate0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de448#Observation.value[x]
138Offer or refer for support for disclosure and partner services0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de450#Observation.value[x]
139A test or screening recommended for the client's care plan at a future date0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de461#Observation.value[x]

Documentation for this format

item.text: Whether visit was scheduled or unscheduled, clinical only or for ARV drug pick-up
Select if this is a scheduled visit
Temperature of the client in Celsius
The number of breaths per minute
The number of heartbeats per minute
The client's height in centimetres

Month and year client originally started ART (documented) at a health facility in the system. The cohort is a group of patients who started ART in the same month (or quarter) and year, whose status is followed over time, using the ART register.

Name of health facility client was transferred from

Date client first enrols in HIV care at the facility. This applies to new clients (may also be the same date started on ART).?Begins when a person with a confirmed HIV diagnosis presents to a facility where HIV care is provided and a medical record, patient card, file or chart is opened for the first time. This could be at an HIV care/ART, MNCH or TB clinic.?WHO recommends that all patients be enrolled in HIV care at their first facility visit following an HIV-positive diagnosis (which may take place in the same facility or on the same day as the HIV diagnosis).?For patients who may have received prior ART, “newly enrolled” includes treatment-experienced patients with or without clinical records who received ART from sources outside the system (e.g. patient seen by private practitioner, patient buys drugs themselves or is sent drugs), or PrEP or short-course ARV prophylaxis for PMTCT, and have not been counted as “newly enrolled” in a system that is being monitored nationally. If a facility receives a treatment-experienced patient without records who was previously treated at a facility that reports to the national programme (and, therefore, reported as “newly enrolled” once before), an attempt should be made to retrieve the records and confirm that the patient was previously on treatment.

WHO clinical stage of client based on signs and symptoms. WHO clinical staging is a way to categorize HIV disease severity based on new or recurrent clinical events. There are 4 WHO clinical stages that range from mild symptoms (WHO clinical stage 1) to severe symptoms (WHO clinical stage 4).
